intro: Cephaelis subcoriacea, commonly known as the velvetleaf celandine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, velvety texture, giving it its common name. Cephaelis subcoriacea is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
